titleInfo.title: Letter from Benjamin Jervis, East India Company Resident at Bushere [Bushire], to Peter Elwin Wrench, East India Company Agent at Basra

mods.abstract: The letter covers various subjects:the author's response to recent complaints about the tone of his letters made by Wrench;the arrival from Carrack [Kharg] Island of the Dutch writer, John Jacob Christant, seeking compensation for what was stolen from him by the English during the withdrawal from Gombroon [Bandar Abbas] in 1763;the situation between Carem Khaun [Karim Khan], Meer Mahanna [Mīr Muhanna], and the Chaub [Banu Ka‘b];the lessening of the Khan's opinion of the English;reports that the Dutch are attacking Mīr Muhanna with Shaik Sadoon's [Sheikh Sa‘dūn] assistance.
